text: Sarah Kate Lavin (born 28 May 1994) is an Irishwoman specialising in the high hurdles. She finished fourth at the 2019 Summer Universiade. In addition, she won a silver medal at the 2013 European Junior Championships. Her personal bests are 13.23 seconds in the 100 metres hurdles (-3.3 m/s, Geneva 2014) and 8.25 seconds in the 60 metres hurdles (Sheffield 2014). ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |2012 |World Junior Championships |Barcelona, Spain |18th (h) |100 m hurdles |13.901 |- |2013 |European Junior Championships |Rieti, Italy |bgcolor=silver|2nd |100 m hurdles |13.34 |- |rowspan=2|2014 |rowspan=2|European Championships |rowspan=2|Zürich, Switzerland |29th (h) |100 m hurdles |13.25 |- |10th (h) |4 × 100 m relay |43.84 |- |rowspan=3|2015 |World Relays |Nassau, Bahamas |5th |4 × 200 m relay |1:36.90 |- |rowspan=2|European U23 Championships |rowspan=2|Tallinn, Estonia |17th (h) |100 m hurdles |13.87 |- |5th (h) |4 × 100 m relay |44.682 |- |2017 |Universiade |Taipei, Taiwan |9th (sf) |100 m hurdles |13.64 |- |2019 |Universiade |Naples, Italy |4th |100 m hurdles |13.28 |} 1Did not finish in the semifinals 2Did not finish in the final ==References== Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:Irish female hurdlers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2019 European Games Category:European Games competitors for Ireland Category:Competitors at the 2017 Summer Universiade Category:Competitors at the 2019 Summer Universiade
title: Sarah Lavin
